IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EMPOWER STUDENTS TO LEARN WITH PASSION, ACT WITH INTEGRITY, AND SERVE WITH RESPECT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO EMPOWER STUDENTS TO LEARN WITH PASSION, ACT WITH INTEGRITY, AND SERVE WITH RESPECT.
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATION FOR APPROXIMATELY 800 STUDENTS, 184 OF WHOM ARE BOARDING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). INCOME FROM CERTAIN ACTIVITIES NOT DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE SCHOOLS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE IS SUBJECT TO TAXATION AS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. FOR THE YEARS ENDED MAY 31, 2016 AND 2015, THE SCHOOL DID NOT HAVE ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, AND ACCORDINGLY, NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX. THE SCHOOL BELIEVES IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOLS INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FILINGS FOR THE PREVIOUS THREE YEARS REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 4B

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FULL NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY IS PUBLISHED IN THE SCHOOL PARENT AND STUDENT HANDBOOK WHICH CAN FOUND ON THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE. IN ADDITION, THE POLICY IS DISCLOSED ON THE SCHOOL APPLICATION PAPERWORK AND IN THE RECRUITING AND ADMISSIONS BROCHURE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DARLINGTON SCHOOL OFFERS A LIMITED AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BASED SOLELY ON FINANCIAL NEED. APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO FURNISH INFORMATION PERTINENT TO THE DETERMINATION OF PARENTAL INCOME AND THE ABILITY TO MEET TUITION REQUIREMENTS. EACH APPLICATION IS CONSIDERED BY DARLINGTON SCHOOL FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

PART I, LINE 4B - SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN THE SCHOOL HAS AN AGREEMENT WITH THE RETIRED HEADMASTER TO PAY HIM 250,000 IN SUPPLEMENTAL COMPENSATION AT MAY 31, 2014. NO PAYMENTS WERE MADE AS OF MAY 31, 2014. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2016, PAYMENTS OF 62,500 WERE MADE TO THE RETIRED HEADMASTER. THE REMAINING PAYMENTS WILL BE MADE OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT TWO YEARS. PART I, LINE 1A - FRINGE OR EXPENSE EXPLANATION TRAVEL FOR COMPANIONS - TRAVEL FOR SPOUSES IS PAID IN SITUATIONS WHERE A SPOUSE WOULD NORMALLY ATTEND THAT EVENT TAX INDEMNIFICATION AND GROSS-UP PAYMENTS/HEALTH OR SOCIAL CLUB DUES OR INITIATION FEES - DARLINGTON PROVIDES CLUB MEMBERSHIPS FOR TWO INDIVIDUALS, DUE TO ACCESS TO THESE FACILITIES ARE NEEDED TO CONDUCT SCHOOL BUSINESS. THE MEMBERSHIP ALONG WITH THE TAX GROSS-UP IS INCLUDED IN THE EMPLOYEES' TAXABLE INCOME. HOUSING ALLOWANCE OR RESIDENCE FOR PERSONAL USE - DUE TO DARLINGTON HAVING A BOARDING COMPONENT, THE HEADMASTER AND ASST. HEADMASTER LIVE ON CAMPUS. PERSONAL SERVICES - A MAID SERVICE IS PROVIDED TO ONE KEY EMPLOYEE. THE HOME IS A LARGE, HISTORIC HOME WHERE DARLINGTON FUNCTIONS ARE HELD.
FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CFO, CONTROLLER, AND HEAD OF SCHOOL BEFORE THE BOARD REVIEWS.
CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE SIGNED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD.
BOARD REVIEWS HEADMASTER PERFORMANCE; HEADMASTER REVIEWS CFO PERFORMANCE. USE NAIS SALARY DATA FOR COMPARABLE SCHOOLS.
BOARD REVIEWS HEADMASTER PERFORMANCE; HEADMASTER REVIEWS CFO PERFORMANCE. USE NAIS SALARY DATA FOR COMPARABLE SCHOOLS.
AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE BUSINESS OFFICE.
